poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Folks, I've become more mortal than I'd like. First it was milky sweat like my old dad, Then a putrid gust. What floats and keeps me Is cubes of reason. Just cast off And it's rot and sink, or sink and rot. Although, There's a force of heart To jigger habits, An earthquake storm to rubble forts. Ach, Swim a bit. 'Said and done You're three-fourths salt and water.
